results.title: Le Bossu = the Hunchback
results.brief_description:
Lagardere vows to protect Aurore, the baby daughter of his friend, Philippe de Nevers, who has just been murdered by his cousin Gonzague, who was coveting his fortune. Falsely accused of the murder, Lagardere swears he will seek to avenge his friend and help Aurore recover her fortune and rank in society. This favourite swashbuckling adventure has also been filmed by Andre Hunebelle (1960) and Philippe de Broca (1997).

Credits: Producer, Jason Regina ; director, Jean Delannoy ; writer, Bernard Zimmer ; photography, Christian Matras ; music, Georges Auric.
Cast: Paul Bernard, Pierre Blanchar, Yvonne Gaudeau, Jean Marchat, Lucien Nat, Helene Vercors.

results.title: Le Bonheur et la Mort = Happiness and Death
results.brief_description:
In the XIVth century, art is no longer controlled by the church or the kings. The new mecenes are the princes and the patrician class. Under their impulse, art becomes more attentive to the depiction of secular life. Works of art are less gandiose, smaller and destined to a private use as illustrated by the somptuous Livre d’Heures (prayer book) commissioned by Duke Jean de Berry. XIVth century aristocracy is intoxicated by stories of chivalry and the knights of round table. Art depicts in minute details the idyllic life of knight, entirely devoted to hunting, tournament and the pursuit of ‘l’amour courtois’.

Credits: Director, Roland Darbois ; writers, Roger Stephane, Roland Darbois, photography, Roland Dantigny.
Cast: Narrated by Georges Duby.

results.title: Le bleu perdu
results.creator_credit: Pierre Moretti, ONF | NFB and Paul Driessen
results.brief_description: An animated cartoon envisaging the kind of world that children of the future may well inherit when the last vestige of blue is blotted out from the sky by the spreading mantle of smog. In this story a little boy set out to find the blue sky he has been told of. A film without word.

results.brief_description: The Mills Brothers Musical Film Revue perform three songs in three different settings: Lazy River (2:33 mins), Rockin’ Chair (3:00 mins), Till Then (2:45 mins).

results.title: Layout and handling in factories
results.brief_description: The effect on production costs, time and workers’ well-being of imperfect factory layout. Various examples show that regrouping of existing equipment and the addition of new can significantly increase productivity and repay capital outlay.
results.description: The effect on production costs, time and workers’ well-being of imperfect factory layout. Various examples show that regrouping of existing equipment and the addition of new can significantly increase productivity and repay capital outlay.

results.title: Laying it on the line
results.creator_credit: R and R Productions, Victorian Film Corporation and Ron V. Brown
results.brief_description: Gives a general overview of the method of planning excavation, laying and testing of two types of drainage materials - stoneware and PVC pipes. The need for correct installation methods current with present procedures are clearly shown.

results.title: Lay lady lay
results.creator_credit: Kratky Film, J. Hekrdla and Vladimir Jirawck
results.brief_description: Presents a clever, animated statement on morale and productivity, two key problems in every business field. An overworked hen is rejuvenated after a visit to her company psychiatrist.

results.title: Lawson's Australia (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Fred Dumar, Jim Brown and Michael Dickinson
results.brief_description: This video looks at Lawson through the poems he wrote at various stages of his life and gives a deep insight into Lawson’s complex character. What makes Henry Lawson a powerful writer is that he tapped his impoverished childhood and unhappy adult life to produce poetry and prose of great beauty. By walking hundreds of miles across the continent of Australia, he developed a unique understanding of the outback men and women and his writing captures the nature of the tough breed of people who settled in a harsh, unforgiving land.

results.title: Laws of heredity
results.creator_credit: David Bennett and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology Program. Unit 5. Heredity and Adaptive Change”.
Shows how inheritance is determined in statistically predictable ways. Presents the insights and conclusions about inheritance that were first discovered by Gregor Mendel. Suitable for upper secondary level.
